ASLClient

ASLClient instances maintain a client connection to the ASL daemon, and can used to perform logging and to execute log search queries.

Note: Because the underlying client connection is not intended to be shared across threads, each ASLClient has an associated GCD serial queue used to ensure that the underlying ASL client connection is only ever used from a single thread.

  • Options

    Represents ASL client creation option values, which are used to determine the behavior of an ASLClient. These are bit-flag values that can be combined and otherwise manipulated with bitwise operators.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public struct Options: RawOptionSetType, BooleanType
  • sender

    The string that will be used by ASL the sender of any log messages passed to the receiver’s log() function.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let sender: String?
  • facility

    The string that will be used by ASL the facility of any log messages passed to the receiver’s log() function.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let facility: String?
  • filterMask

    The receiver’s filter mask.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let filterMask: Int32
  • useRawStdErr

    If true, the receiver is mirroring log entries in raw form to the standard error stream; false otherwise.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let useRawStdErr: Bool
  • options

    The ASLClient.Options value that determines the behavior of ASL.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let options: Options
  • queue

    The GCD queue used to serialize log operations. This is exposed to allow low-level ASL operations not supported by ASLClient to be performed using the underlying aslclient. This queue must be used for all ASL operations using the receiver’s client property.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let queue: dispatch_queue_t
  • isOpen

    Determines whether the receiver’s connection to the ASL

    Declaration

    public var isOpen: Bool { return client != nil }
  • client

    The aslclient associated with the receiver.

    Declaration

    public let client: aslclient
  • init(sender:facility:filterMask:useRawStdErr:options:)

    Initializes a new ASLClient instance.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public init(sender: String? = nil, facility: String? = nil, filterMask: Int32 = ASLPriorityLevel.Debug.filterMaskUpTo, useRawStdErr: Bool = true, options: Options = .NoRemote)

    Parameters

    sender

    Will be used as the ASLAttributeKey value for the .Sender key for all log messages sent to ASL. If nil, ASL will use the process name.
    facility

    Will be used as the ASLAttributeKey value for the .Facility key for all log messages sent to ASL. If nil, ASL will select a default.
    filterMask

    Specifies the priority filter that should be applied to messages sent to the log.
    useRawStdErr

    If true, messages sent through the ASLClient will be mirrored to standard error without modification. Note that this differs from the behavior of the .StdErr value for the ASLClient.Options parameter, which performs some escaping and may add additional text to the message.
    options

    An ASLClient.Options value specifying the client options to be used by this new client. Note that if the .StdErr value is passed and rawStdErr is also true, the behavior of rawStdErr will be used, overriding the .StdErr behavior.
  • log(_:logSynchronously:currentQueue:)

    Sends the message to the Apple System Log.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func log(message: ASLMessageObject, logSynchronously: Bool = false, currentQueue: dispatch_queue_t? = nil)

    Parameters

    message

    the ASLMessageObject to send to Apple System Log.
    logSynchronously

    If true, the log() function will perform synchronously. You should not set this to true in production code; it will degrade performance. Synchronous logging can be useful when debugging to ensure that up-to-date log messages are visible in the console.
    currentQueue

    If the log message is already being processed on a given GCD queue, a reference to that queue should be passed in. That way, if currentQueue has the same value as the receiver’s queue property, no additional dispatching will take place. This is needed to avoid deadlocks when external code directly uses the receiver’s queue to perform operations related to logging.
  • search(_:callback:)

    Asynchronously reads the ASL log, issuing one call to the callback function for each relevant entry in the log.

    Only entries that have a valid timestamp and message will be provided to the callback.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func search(query: ASLQueryObject, callback: ASLQueryObject.ResultCallback)

    Parameters

    query

    The ASLQueryObject representing the search query to run.
    callback

    The callback function to be invoked for each log entry. Make no assumptions about which thread will be calling the function.
